oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1942-07-11 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from July 11, 1942. Featuring David Cobb (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys including Rachel Veach and Bashful Brother Oswald, Tommy Thompson, Pap's Jug Band, the John Daniel Quartet, Paul Howard, Howdy Forrester, Robert Lunn, and Mac McGar. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Howdy Forrester; Roy Acuff; Robert Lunn; Mac McGar
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Prince Albert commercial (George D. Hay, Roy Acuff, David Cobb) -- Wake Up Susan (Howdy Forrester fiddle) -- Prince Albert commercial (George D. Hay, Bashful Brother Oswald) -- The Heart That Was Broken For Me (Roy Acuff) -- George D. Hay introduces Robert Lunn -- Mama Don't Allow (Robert Lunn) -- George D. Hay introduces Mac McGar -- Katy Hill (Mac McGar fiddle) -- Prince Albert commercial (David Cobb, George D. Hay) -- Ida Red (Roy Acuff) -- Closing statement (George D. Hay, Bashful Brother Oswald)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Cobb, David (Announcer); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Bashful Brother Oswald; Veach, Rachel; Wilson, Lonnie; Pap's Jug Band; Forrester, Howdy, 1922-1987; McGar, Mac; Thompson, Tommy, 1923-2007; John Daniel Quartet; Howard, Paul, 1908-1984; Lunn, Robert;
